programs.name: 2-1-1 Bay Area
programs.description: Free 24/7 referral to food, housing, legal help, health care, and more

programs.name: CZI Community Space
programs.description: Free meeting and event spaces for select local nonprofits including rooms for up to 150 people, coworking areas, A/V equipment, and kitchen access

programs.name: Dolly Parton Imagination Library
programs.description: Free book mailed monthly to child's home for kids (up to age 5); high-quality, age-appropriate books selected by experts; builds home library of up to 60 books by kindergarten

programs.name: Generation Thrive
programs.description: Free meeting and event spaces for Bay Area-based nonprofits including conference rooms, coworking space, A/V equipment, and printing; priority for Warriors and Kaiser grantees

programs.name: Google Community Space
programs.description: Free event and meeting spaces for Bay Area-based nonprofits including A/V equipment, coworking areas, kitchen access, and technology tools; limited to one event per quarter

programs.name: Salesforce Ohana Floor
programs.description: Free 61st-floor event space for Bay Area-based nonprofits with capacity up to 250 guests; includes A/V support and event staff; available once every 12 months

programs.name: Season of Sharing Fund
programs.description: Emergency rental and basic needs assistance to prevent homelessness

programs.name: Sobrato Nonprofit Centers Conference Space
programs.description: Free meeting and conference space for nonprofits ranging from 3 to 200 people; includes A/V equipment and hospitality areas

programs.name: Tides Converge
programs.description: Meeting and event spaces for local nonprofits and social enterprises within a large shared campus; also offers affordable coworking memberships and office leases

programs.name: VA Vet Centers
programs.description: Community & mental health support

programs.name: YMCA
programs.description: Most locations offer sliding-scale membership rates

programs.name: Bay Area Crisis Nursery - Emergency Childcare
programs.description: FREE emergency childcare for children birth-6; up to 30 days per 6 months, 60 days per year

programs.name: California State Preschool Program
programs.description: Free part-day preschool for income-eligible families with children 3-5

programs.name: CalWORKs Child Care
programs.description: Free or subsidized child care for CalWORKs participants (3 stages)

programs.name: Children's Council San Francisco
programs.description: Partial or complete coverage of childcare costs for children age 0-13; for state funded programs only

programs.name: Choices for Children
programs.description: Subsidized child care for income-eligible families

programs.name: Head Start
programs.description: Free preschool for low-income families with children 3-4

programs.name: Bay Area Crisis Nursery - BACN Boutique
programs.description: Free clothing, shoes, books, toys, baby equipment for families; includes maternity and parent items

programs.name: Bay Area Crisis Nursery - Food Pantry & Diaper Bank
programs.description: Free food and diapers for families in need

programs.name: San Francisco Diaper Bank
programs.description: Free diapers for CalFresh, Medi-Cal, and CalWORKs households with children under age two (up to two cases per child/month)

programs.name: St. Anthony's Free Clothing Program
programs.description: Free clothing for men, women, and children; SF's largest free clothing program serving 3,000+ people monthly

programs.name: California Grants Portal
programs.description: Free searchable database of state grant opportunities for nonprofits and community organizations

programs.name: San Mateo County Strong Fund
programs.description: Household expense assistance for individuals and families; also supports small businesses and nonprofits serving vulnerable populations

programs.name: HIP Housing Home Sharing Program
programs.description: Free matching service connecting housing providers with compatible singles, seniors, or single parents seeking shared housing arrangements

programs.name: LifeMoves Opportunity Services Center
programs.description: Emergency interim shelter, food, clothing, and intensive case management for families in crisis; includes specialized veteran support programs

programs.name: Haven Family House (LifeMoves)
programs.description: Interim shelter and supportive services for 23 families experiencing homelessness; serves up to 9 veteran families nightly

programs.name: Friendly Voices Phone Buddies for Seniors
programs.description: Weekly volunteer phone calls offering supportive listening and confidentiality for isolated, homebound seniors age 60+

programs.name: Housing Accessibility Modifications Program
programs.description: Grants for home modifications to improve accessibility for disabled and elderly persons

programs.name: ECHO Housing
programs.description: Addresses housing discrimination complaints and ensures equal access to housing

programs.name: Fixit Clinics
programs.description: Free community repair workshops with volunteer coaches to help fix broken electronics, appliances, computers, toys, sewing machines, and textiles; tools and workspace provided

programs.name: San Mateo County Library Open Sewing Programs
programs.description: Free open sewing and mending programs at multiple library branches including Foster City, Half Moon Bay, Millbrae, Redwood City, San Mateo, and South San Francisco

programs.name: Recyclestuff.org
programs.description: Free search engine to find nearby donation and recycling locations for household items, electronics, clothing, and more

programs.name: ReFuel Your Fun Program
programs.description: Discounted propane refills for reusable cylinders as alternative to single-use 1 lb. propane cylinders

programs.name: American Cancer Society Discovery Shop (Menlo Park)
programs.description: Thrift store accepting donations of clothing, accessories, housewares, linens, furniture, and collectibles; proceeds support cancer research and patient programs

programs.name: Ecumenical Hunger Program Donations
programs.description: Accepts donations of clothing, housewares, furniture, small appliances, and more; serves East Palo Alto and neighboring communities; pickup available for large items

programs.name: Family Connections Donations
programs.description: Accepts donations of baby and child-related items including strollers, toys, books, and clothing; serves families with young children

programs.name: Goodwill Industries (SF, San Mateo, Marin)
programs.description: Accepts donations of clothing, electronics, furniture, housewares, books, and sporting goods; proceeds fund job training programs; multiple donation centers available

programs.name: Latino Commission Donations
programs.description: Accepts donations of clothing, shoes, housewares, small furniture, and small electronics to support alcohol and drug recovery services

programs.name: Nine Lives Foundation
programs.description: Accepts donations of pet supplies, bedding, and cat-related items to support cat rescue and adoption programs

programs.name: PARCA Thrift Shop
programs.description: Accepts donations of clothing, housewares, small furniture, and collectibles; proceeds support adults with developmental disabilities; pickup available for large items

programs.name: Peninsula Humane Society & SPCA Donations
programs.description: Accepts donations of pet supplies, animal care items, and usable household goods for resale; proceeds support animal rescue and adoption programs

programs.name: Pick of the Litter Books
programs.description: Accepts donations of used books, CDs, DVDs, and vinyl records; proceeds support Peninsula Humane Society & SPCA programs

programs.name: Puente de la Costa Sur
programs.description: Accepts donations of clothing, housewares, furniture, and building materials; serves South Coast San Mateo County communities; pickup available

programs.name: St. Francis Center (Redwood City)
programs.description: Accepts donations of clothing, shoes, bedding, housewares, furniture, and appliances; serves low-income families in Redwood City area; pickup available

programs.name: St. Vincent de Paul Society (San Mateo County)
programs.description: Accepts donations of clothing, furniture, housewares, and appliances; operates thrift stores with proceeds supporting homeless and low-income assistance programs; pickup available for large items

programs.name: Samaritan House Thrift Stores
programs.description: Accepts donations of clothing, housewares, furniture, electronics, and sporting goods; proceeds support free food, health, and housing programs for low-income residents

programs.name: Savers Thrift Stores
programs.description: For-profit thrift store accepting donations of clothing, housewares, books, and more; partners with local nonprofits who receive funds based on donation volume

programs.name: South Coast Children's Services
programs.description: Accepts donations of children's items, toys, books, and clothing to support programs serving children and families on the South Coast

programs.name: The Salvation Army (San Mateo County)
programs.description: Accepts donations of clothing, furniture, housewares, electronics, and appliances; operates thrift stores with proceeds supporting social services; free pickup available for large items

programs.name: Turnstyle Thrift Store
programs.description: Accepts donations of clothing, housewares, furniture, and collectibles; proceeds support StarVista crisis intervention and youth services programs

programs.name: United Cerebral Palsy Association of the Golden Gate
programs.description: Accepts donations of clothing, housewares, furniture, electronics, and vehicles; free pickup available; proceeds support services for people with developmental disabilities

programs.name: ACT Fee Waivers
programs.description: Receive two free ACT tests (including optional science/writing); free access to official ACT Self-Paced Course (Kaplan); send scores to up to 20 colleges; can request college application fee waivers

programs.name: AP Exam Fee Reductions
programs.description: $37 College Board fee reduction per exam (schools forgo $9 rebate); final cost typically $53-62 per exam (down from $99); some CA districts provide additional funding bringing cost to $0

programs.name: California College Promise Grant (CCPG)
programs.description: Waives enrollment fees ($46/unit) at all California Community Colleges for entire academic year

programs.name: Common App Fee Waiver
programs.description: Waived application fees at participating colleges through Common App

programs.name: SAT Fee Waivers
programs.description: Receive two free SAT tests; unlimited score reports; waived college app fees via participating colleges; free CSS Profile; waived regional, late, and cancellation fees

programs.name: A Greener Source
programs.description: Zero-cost office furniture donations including desks, chairs, filing cabinets, and other office furnishings; request furniture through website; schedule pickup or delivery

programs.name: Alameda County Property & Salvage Donations
programs.description: Donated surplus county property including office furniture, equipment, and supplies provided to eligible nonprofit organizations as in-kind donations

programs.name: Building Resources
programs.description: Salvaged and reusable building materials including construction supplies, fixtures, and landscaping materials available at reduced cost; some materials available for nonprofit projects

programs.name: California Federal Surplus Property Program
programs.description: Access to donated federal surplus property including furniture, equipment, vehicles, and technology through the State of California for eligible nonprofit organizations

programs.name: City of San Jos√© Surplus Property Donation Program
programs.description: Surplus property (valued at $1,500 or less) available to eligible nonprofits, including equipment, furnishings, and other items

programs.name: Santa Clara County Surplus Property Donation Program
programs.description: Donated surplus county property including office furniture, equipment, and supplies available to eligible nonprofit organizations upon request and approval

programs.name: Santa Clara County Library District Surplus Property Donations
programs.description: Donated surplus library property including furniture, shelving, and equipment for eligible nonprofit organizations located within Santa Clara County

programs.name: San Francisco Virtual Warehouse
programs.description: Free surplus office furniture, supplies, and equipment from the City and County of San Francisco for nonprofits and public schools

programs.name: SCRAP (Scroungers' Center for Re-usable Art Parts)
programs.description: Low-cost and donated arts, crafts, and educational materials including fabric, paper goods, sewing supplies, and classroom resources

programs.name: San Mateo County Surplus Property Program
programs.description: Free surplus office furniture, supplies, and equipment for San Mateo County-based nonprofits and public schools

programs.name: CalABLE
programs.description: California's 529A ABLE savings account program to help people with qualifying disabilities build financial security without risking public benefits.

programs.name: AARP Foundation Tax-Aide
programs.description: Free tax preparation with special attention to those 50+; no age requirement; help with all income levels; available at libraries, community centers, and senior centers

programs.name: Alameda County Social Services Agency VITA
programs.description: Free tax preparation; help with EITC and CalEITC credits

programs.name: Community Gatepath (formerly CCRC) VITA
programs.description: Free tax preparation for low-income individuals and families

programs.name: CSU East Bay VITA
programs.description: Free virtual tax prep via Zoom for income $84,000 or less

programs.name: IRS VITA Site Locator
programs.description: Free tax preparation for individuals and families earning $67,000 or less; help with EITC, Child Tax Credit, and other credits; available in multiple languages

programs.name: EBALDC VITA
programs.description: Free tax preparation

programs.name: Samaritan House VITA
programs.description: Free tax preparation with drop-off service

programs.name: SF State VITA
programs.description: Free tax preparation by accounting students

programs.name: SparkPoint Fremont VITA
programs.description: Free current year and back tax preparation for low-to-moderate income families

programs.name: United Way Bay Area
programs.description: Free, secure, high-quality tax help for low- and middle-income residents across the Bay Area

programs.name: Bay Area Entrepreneur Center
programs.description: Free business management guidance, technical assistance, networking, one-on-one consulting, and business workshops for aspiring and current entrepreneurs

programs.name: San Francisco SCORE
programs.description: Free and confidential business counseling plus low-cost workshops; over 50 retired and active professionals available to help

programs.name: San Mateo Small Business Development Center
programs.description: Free assistance with relief applications, cash flow management, supply chain issues, workforce capacity, and insurance coverage for small businesses

programs.name: NOVA Workforce Development
programs.description: Free employment and training services connecting businesses, educators, and job seekers in Silicon Valley

programs.name: Small Business Finance Center (IBank)
programs.description: Disaster Relief Loan Guarantee, Jump Start Loan Program, and other financing programs for small businesses focusing on job creation in low- to moderate-income communities

programs.name: Alameda County Community Food Bank
programs.description: The Alameda County Community Food Bank is one of the largest food banks in the nation, distributing millions of pounds of food annually through a network of partner agencies and direct distribution programs.

programs.name: Alameda Meals on Wheels
programs.description: Alameda Meals on Wheels delivers nutritious meals to homebound seniors and adults with disabilities in the City of Alameda, providing both nourishment and friendly check-ins.

programs.name: Bernal Heights Neighborhood Center - Brown Bag Program
programs.description: Bernal Heights Neighborhood Center provides food assistance to San Francisco residents, including a weekly Brown Bag program for seniors and a food pantry serving all community members.

programs.name: CalFresh Online
programs.description: CalFresh (California's SNAP/food stamps program) now allows beneficiaries to purchase groceries online from select retailers, making food access more convenient for those with transportation or mobility challenges.

programs.name: CalFresh Restaurant Meals Program (RMP)
programs.description: The Restaurant Meals Program allows certain CalFresh recipients to use their EBT benefits at participating restaurants, helping those who may not have access to cooking facilities or ability to prepare meals.

programs.name: Food Bank of Contra Costa & Solano
programs.description: The Food Bank of Contra Costa and Solano serves two counties with free food distribution, helping fight hunger through a network of partners and direct community programs.

programs.name: J-Sei Meals on Wheels
programs.description: J-Sei provides culturally appropriate Japanese-style home-delivered meals to seniors in Alameda County, honoring cultural food traditions while ensuring nutrition and social connection.

programs.name: Market Match
programs.description: Market Match doubles the value of CalFresh and WIC benefits at participating farmers markets, making fresh, locally grown fruits and vegetables more affordable for low-income families.

programs.name: Meals on Wheels Contra Costa
programs.description: Meals on Wheels Contra Costa delivers nutritious meals to homebound seniors and adults with disabilities, providing nutrition, independence, and social connection through daily visits.

programs.name: Meals on Wheels Diablo Region
programs.description: Meals on Wheels Diablo Region serves the eastern Contra Costa County area, delivering meals and providing vital social connections to homebound seniors and adults with disabilities.

programs.name: Meals on Wheels San Francisco
programs.description: Meals on Wheels San Francisco delivers nutritious meals to homebound seniors and adults with disabilities throughout San Francisco, ensuring no one goes hungry due to age, illness, or isolation.

programs.name: Meals on Wheels San Mateo County (Peninsula Volunteers)
programs.description: Peninsula Volunteers operates Meals on Wheels in San Mateo County, delivering nutritious meals to homebound adults 60+ while providing vital social connection and wellness checks.

programs.name: Project Open Hand
programs.description: Project Open Hand provides medically tailored meals and groceries to people living with serious illnesses, as well as nutritious meals to seniors. Since 1985, they've served millions of meals with love.

programs.name: Rainbow Grocery
programs.description: Rainbow Grocery is a worker-owned cooperative grocery store in San Francisco offering natural and organic foods, with discounts for seniors and EBT cardholders.

programs.name: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley
programs.description: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley is one of the largest food banks in the nation, providing food to nearly half a million people each month through a network of 900+ partners and direct distribution sites.

programs.name: SF-Marin Food Bank
programs.description: The SF-Marin Food Bank provides food to 1 in 4 San Francisco and Marin County residents, operating the largest food pantry network in the region with free groceries and nutrition programs.

programs.name: SOS Meals on Wheels
programs.description: SOS Meals on Wheels serves the Oakland and surrounding areas with daily home-delivered meals for homebound seniors, providing nutrition and social connection for over 50 years.

programs.name: Sourcewise Meals on Wheels
programs.description: Sourcewise provides Meals on Wheels throughout Santa Clara County, delivering two nutritious meals daily to homebound seniors and adults with disabilities.

programs.name: Spectrum Community Services Meals on Wheels
programs.description: Spectrum Community Services delivers Meals on Wheels to seniors in central and east Contra Costa County, helping older adults maintain independence and nutrition at home.

programs.name: St. Anthony's Dining Room
programs.description: St. Anthony's Dining Room has served San Francisco's Tenderloin neighborhood since 1950, providing free hot meals daily with dignity and respect to all who are hungry, no questions asked.

programs.name: Universal School Meals
programs.description: California became the first state to offer universal free school meals to all public school students regardless of family income, ensuring every child has access to nutritious breakfast and lunch.

programs.name: WIC ‚Äì Women, Infants & Children
programs.description: WIC is California's nutrition program for pregnant and postpartum women, infants, and children under 5, providing healthy food, nutrition education, breastfeeding support, and healthcare referrals.

programs.name: YMCA Food Pantries
programs.description: The YMCA of San Francisco operates food pantries throughout the Bay Area, providing free groceries to families and individuals facing food insecurity.

programs.name: Ecumenical Hunger Program
programs.description: The Ecumenical Hunger Program serves East Palo Alto and surrounding communities with nutritionally balanced food boxes, helping families stretch their food budgets.

programs.name: JFCS Food Pantry
programs.description: Jewish Family and Children's Services (JFCS) operates a food pantry providing high-protein, nutritious food to seniors, disabled adults, and low-income families in Santa Clara County.

programs.name: Got Groceries Program
programs.description: Peninsula Volunteers' Got Groceries program provides weekly bags of free groceries to individuals and families facing food insecurity in San Mateo County.

programs.name: 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline
programs.description: The 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline is a national network of local crisis centers providing free, confidential emotional support 24/7 to people in suicidal crisis or emotional distress.

programs.name: Crisis Text Line
programs.description: Crisis Text Line is a free, 24/7 text-based mental health support service connecting people in crisis with trained volunteer counselors through text messages.

programs.name: Denti-Cal
programs.description: Denti-Cal is California's Medicaid dental program, providing comprehensive dental care to Medi-Cal beneficiaries at no cost, helping ensure oral health for low-income individuals and families.

programs.name: EyeCare America
programs.description: EyeCare America is a public service program of the American Academy of Ophthalmology providing eye care to seniors through volunteer ophthalmologists who donate their services.

programs.name: Medi-Cal (Medicaid)
programs.description: Medi-Cal is California's Medicaid program, providing free or low-cost health coverage to millions of Californians including low-income adults, families, seniors, pregnant women, and people with disabilities.

programs.name: NeedyMeds
programs.description: NeedyMeds is a nonprofit providing a comprehensive database of patient assistance programs, helping people find affordable medications and healthcare services regardless of insurance status.

programs.name: Planned Parenthood
programs.description: Planned Parenthood is a trusted healthcare provider offering sexual and reproductive health services on a sliding fee scale, ensuring care is accessible regardless of insurance status or ability to pay.

programs.name: Ryan White HIV/AIDS Program
programs.description: The Ryan White HIV/AIDS Program provides comprehensive care and support services for people living with HIV who are uninsured or underinsured, filling gaps in care not covered by other sources.

programs.name: SAMHSA National Helpline
programs.description: SAMHSA's National Helpline is a free, confidential, 24/7 treatment referral and information service for individuals and families facing mental health and/or substance use disorders.

programs.name: VA Health Benefits
programs.description: VA Health Benefits provide comprehensive healthcare services to eligible veterans through the Veterans Health Administration, the nation's largest integrated healthcare system.

programs.name: WIC (Women, Infants, Children)
programs.description: WIC is a nutrition program providing healthy food, nutrition education, breastfeeding support, and healthcare referrals to pregnant and postpartum women, infants, and children under 5 in California.

programs.name: Behavioral Health and Recovery Services (BHRS)
programs.description: San Mateo County Behavioral Health and Recovery Services provides mental health and substance use treatment, prevention, and recovery services to residents of all ages in San Mateo County.

programs.name: Aging and Adult Services
programs.description: San Mateo County Aging and Adult Services provides protective services, in-home care, and nutrition programs to help older adults and people with disabilities live safely and independently.

programs.name: San Mateo County Pregnancy, Children and Families
programs.description: San Mateo County's Family Health Services provides prenatal care, home visiting, and child health programs to support healthy pregnancies and child development for families throughout the county.

programs.name: CalRx OTC Naloxone Nasal Spray
programs.description: CalRx is California's initiative to make naloxone, a life-saving medication that reverses opioid overdoses, affordable and accessible to all residents without a prescription.

programs.name: Naloxone Distribution Project (NDP)
programs.description: California's Naloxone Distribution Project provides free naloxone and fentanyl test strips to eligible nonprofit organizations working to prevent opioid overdose deaths in their communities.

programs.name: AIDS Drug Assistance Program (ADAP)
programs.description: California's AIDS Drug Assistance Program provides life-saving HIV/AIDS medications and health insurance assistance to low-income Californians living with HIV who lack adequate coverage.

programs.name: Kick It California (Quit Smoking Helpline)
programs.description: Kick It California is the state's free quit smoking and tobacco helpline, offering personalized coaching, a mobile app, and resources to help Californians quit tobacco, vaping, and marijuana.

programs.name: Black Infant Health Program
programs.description: The Black Infant Health Program is California's community-based program providing group support and education to Black women and birthing people during pregnancy and the first year of their baby's life.

programs.name: California Home Visiting Program
programs.description: The California Home Visiting Program provides free, voluntary home visits to pregnant women and families with young children, offering parenting support, health education, and connections to community resources.

programs.name: Vaccines for Children (VFC) Program
programs.description: The Vaccines for Children program provides free vaccines to children 18 and under who might not otherwise be vaccinated because of inability to pay, ensuring all children have access to life-saving immunizations.

programs.name: PrEP Assistance Program (PrEP-AP)
programs.description: California's PrEP Assistance Program makes HIV prevention medication accessible to residents who might not otherwise afford it, covering the cost of PrEP medication, doctor visits, and lab tests.

programs.name: Every Woman Counts
programs.description: Every Woman Counts provides free breast and cervical cancer screenings to uninsured and underinsured California women, helping detect cancer early when treatment is most effective.

programs.name: Comprehensive Perinatal Services Program (CPSP)
programs.description: The Comprehensive Perinatal Services Program provides enhanced prenatal and postpartum care to Medi-Cal recipients, offering additional support services beyond standard obstetric care to improve birth outcomes.

programs.name: Childhood Lead Poisoning Prevention Program
programs.description: California's Childhood Lead Poisoning Prevention Program provides screening, case management, and environmental investigation to protect children from lead exposure, which can cause learning disabilities and developmental delays.

programs.name: MyTurn
programs.description: MyTurn is California's official vaccine scheduling and digital record system, making it easy to find vaccine appointments, access your immunization records, and stay up to date on recommended vaccines.

programs.name: Court Fee Waivers
programs.description: Filing fees waived

programs.name: Justice & Diversity Center (JDC)
programs.description: Pro bono legal services for low-income/unhoused San Francisco residents and local nonprofits that serve low-income communities

programs.name: Racial Equity Project (REP)
programs.description: Pro bono legal support for Black-led nonprofit organizations through partnerships with community foundations

programs.name: SF Financial Justice Project
programs.description: Helps reduce or eliminate certain city fines and fees (parking, towing, etc.) for eligible residents

programs.name: San Francisco Immigrant Support
programs.description: Free or low-cost immigration legal help (citizenship, green cards, DACA, etc.)

programs.name: USCIS I-912 Fee Waiver
programs.description: Waiver of filing fees for certain immigration forms based on income/benefits

programs.name: Community Legal Services in East Palo Alto
programs.description: Free legal services for low-income families including immigration, housing, workers' rights, record clearance, and consumer protection

programs.name: Legal Aid Society of San Mateo County
programs.description: Free legal help for housing, healthcare access, economic security, immigration, education, and freedom from violence and abuse

programs.name: Project Sentinel Fair Housing
programs.description: Free fair housing education, counseling, and housing discrimination complaint investigation and advocacy

programs.name: Berkeley Tool Lending Library
programs.description: Borrow tools (power tools, lawn care equipment, etc.) free with library card

programs.name: California State Parks Library Pass
programs.description: Free vehicle day-use entry to 200+ participating state parks (1 vehicle up to 9 people or 1 motorcycle). Not valid for camping, museums within parks, or special events.

programs.description: Free Calm access for qualifying library patrons with guided meditations, courses, stories, music, and stress management tools via web and mobile app

programs.name: Discover & Go Museum Passes
programs.description: Free/discounted museum tickets and passes via library-partner access

programs.description: Low-cost spay/neuter services

programs.name: Marin Humane Society - Pet Care Assistance
programs.description: Pet care assistance for low-income seniors, people living with HIV/AIDS, and hospice recipients; Pet Meals on Wheels

programs.name: Muttville Senior Dog Rescue - Cuddle Club
programs.description: Free cuddle time events with senior dogs for adults 62+ (no adoption required)

programs.name: Muttville Senior Dog Rescue - Seniors for Seniors
programs.description: Free adoption of senior dogs (7+ years) for seniors 62+

programs.name: Peninsula Humane Society - Mobile Spay/Neuter Van
programs.description: Free spay/neuter

programs.name: Peninsula Humane Society SPCA Low-Cost Vaccine Clinics
programs.description: Low-cost vaccinations, microchipping, nail trims

programs.name: Pet Help Finder
programs.description: Database of low-cost vet services, financial assistance, and pet resources by location

programs.name: Pets in Need - Low-Cost Vet Services
programs.description: Low-cost vet care, spay/neuter, vaccinations, microchipping, and more

programs.name: Pets of the Homeless
programs.description: Free veterinary care and pet food assistance for people experiencing homelessness

programs.name: San Francisco SPCA - Community Clinic
programs.description: Affordable preventative care, including vaccines, parasite protection, and treatment for minor conditions

programs.name: San Francisco SPCA - Spay/Neuter
programs.description: Affordable spay/neuter services with tiered fees for eligible SF residents

programs.name: SF Aid for Animals (SFAFA)
programs.description: Financial support for urgent vet services for Bay Area residents with participating veterinary hospitals

programs.name: The Pet Fund
programs.description: Financial assistance for non-basic, non-emergency veterinary care (has waitlist)

programs.name: Vet Billing - Payment Plans
programs.description: Directory of veterinarians offering payment plans or financing options

programs.name: VETCO Clinics
programs.description: Affordable vaccinations and basic pet health services at various locations

programs.name: VIP Petcare
programs.description: Walk-in weekend clinics offering vaccinations, microchipping, testing, flea/tick control (no exam fee)

programs.name: America the Beautiful ‚Äî NPS Pass
programs.description: The National Park Service offers lifetime and annual passes providing access to over 2,000 federal recreation sites across the United States, including national parks, wildlife refuges, and forests.

programs.name: California State Parks Adventure Pass
programs.description: California State Parks offers free access to fourth graders and their families as part of the Every Kid Outdoors initiative, encouraging young people to explore the state's natural and cultural heritage.

programs.name: California State Parks Disabled Discount Pass
programs.description: California State Parks provides lifetime access to residents with permanent disabilities, making outdoor recreation more accessible and affordable for all Californians.

programs.name: California State Parks Distinguished Veteran Pass
programs.description: California honors its veterans with free lifetime access to state parks for those who meet distinguished service requirements, recognizing their sacrifice and service to our country.

programs.name: Golden Bear Pass
programs.description: California State Parks offers the Golden Bear Pass to ensure that cost is not a barrier to enjoying the state's natural treasures, providing free access to income-eligible residents and seniors.

programs.name: Senior Golden Bear Pass
programs.description: California State Parks offers discounted annual passes for seniors age 62 and over, providing access to the state's beautiful parks, beaches, and historic sites during off-peak periods.

programs.name: Museums for All
programs.description: Museums for All is a national program connecting low-income families with cultural institutions, ensuring that financial barriers don't prevent anyone from experiencing the enrichment museums offer.

programs.name: Aquarium of the Bay
programs.description: Aquarium of the Bay is a nonprofit aquarium located on Pier 39 in San Francisco, dedicated to protecting, restoring, and inspiring conservation of San Francisco Bay and its watershed. The aquarium features over 20,000 local marine animals including sharks, rays, jellyfish, and river otters.

programs.name: Asian Art Museum
programs.description: The Asian Art Museum of San Francisco houses one of the world's most comprehensive collections of Asian art, spanning 6,000 years of history with over 18,000 artworks from across the Asian continent.

programs.name: Bay Area Discovery Museum
programs.description: The Bay Area Discovery Museum is a hands-on children's museum nestled at the foot of the Golden Gate Bridge in Sausalito, featuring indoor and outdoor exhibits designed to spark creativity and curiosity in children ages 0-10.

programs.name: California Academy of Sciences
programs.description: The California Academy of Sciences in Golden Gate Park is a world-class scientific and cultural institution featuring a natural history museum, aquarium, planetarium, and rainforest all under one living roof.

programs.name: Chabot Space & Science Center
programs.description: Chabot Space & Science Center in the Oakland hills features interactive space science exhibits, planetarium shows, and three historic telescopes offering free public viewing nights. The center inspires curiosity about the universe and our place in it.

programs.name: Cartoon Art Museum
programs.description: The Cartoon Art Museum is one of only a handful of museums in the United States dedicated to the art of cartoons, animation, and comics. Located in San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf, it celebrates the history and cultural impact of cartoon art.

programs.name: Children's Creativity Museum
programs.description: The Children's Creativity Museum in San Francisco's Yerba Buena Gardens is an interactive arts and technology museum for children ages 2-12, featuring hands-on exhibits that encourage creativity through music, animation, and digital media.

programs.name: Children's Discovery Museum
programs.description: Children's Discovery Museum of San Jose is one of the largest children's museums in the country, featuring interactive exhibits that inspire children to explore, question, and discover the world around them.

programs.name: Children's Fairyland
programs.description: Children's Fairyland is a whimsical storybook theme park on the shores of Lake Merritt in Oakland, designed for children ages 0-8. As one of the first theme parks in America, it has delighted families since 1950 with its enchanting sets, live animals, and puppet shows.

programs.name: Exploratorium
programs.description: The Exploratorium is San Francisco's world-renowned museum of science, art, and human perception. Located on Pier 15, it features over 650 interactive exhibits that encourage hands-on exploration and discovery.

programs.name: Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco
programs.description: The Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco comprise the de Young Museum in Golden Gate Park and the Legion of Honor in Lincoln Park. Together they house an encyclopedic collection spanning over 5,000 years of ancient and European art, American art, textiles, and more.

programs.name: Gardens of Golden Gate Park
programs.description: Golden Gate Park's gardens include the Conservatory of Flowers (a Victorian greenhouse with tropical plants), Japanese Tea Garden (the oldest public Japanese garden in the US), and San Francisco Botanical Garden (featuring 9,000 plant species from around the world).

programs.name: Lawrence Hall of Science
programs.description: The Lawrence Hall of Science is UC Berkeley's public science center, perched in the hills above campus with stunning bay views. It offers hands-on exhibits, planetarium shows, and outdoor science activities for all ages.

programs.name: Museum of the African Diaspora (MoAD)
programs.description: The Museum of the African Diaspora (MoAD) in San Francisco celebrates the history, art, and cultural contributions of people of African descent. Located in the Yerba Buena arts district, it features rotating contemporary art exhibitions and cultural programs.

programs.name: Museum of Craft and Design
programs.description: The Museum of Craft and Design (MCD) in San Francisco's Dogpatch neighborhood explores the creative process through contemporary craft and design. It's the only museum in San Francisco devoted exclusively to craft and design.

programs.name: Oakland Museum of California
programs.description: The Oakland Museum of California (OMCA) is a multidisciplinary museum celebrating California's art, history, and natural sciences. Located near Lake Merritt, it features gardens, exhibitions, and the popular Friday Nights @ OMCA events.

programs.name: Oakland Zoo ‚Äì Bay to Zoo
programs.description: Oakland Zoo is home to over 850 native and exotic animals on 100 acres in the Oakland hills. The zoo is committed to conservation and education, featuring the California Trail exhibit showcasing native wildlife.

programs.name: San Francisco Museum of Modern Art (SFMOMA)
programs.description: SFMOMA is one of the largest museums of modern and contemporary art in the United States, featuring an expansive collection of painting, sculpture, photography, architecture, design, and media arts in its distinctive building in downtown San Francisco.

programs.name: San Jose Museum of Art
programs.description: The San Jose Museum of Art is the leading museum of modern and contemporary art in Silicon Valley, located in a beautiful historic building in downtown San Jose. It features rotating exhibitions and a growing permanent collection.

programs.name: The Tech Interactive
programs.description: The Tech Interactive (formerly The Tech Museum) is a hands-on science and technology center in downtown San Jose. Featuring innovative exhibits on robotics, virtual reality, renewable energy, and more, it inspires the next generation of innovators.

programs.name: Walt Disney Family Museum
programs.description: The Walt Disney Family Museum in San Francisco's Presidio tells the story of Walt Disney's life through interactive galleries featuring original artwork, early drawings, films, music, and a stunning model of Disneyland.

programs.name: 7-Eleven Gold Pass
programs.description: 40% off ($5.99/month) Gold Pass membership for EBT/SNAP recipients, military/veterans, and college students (verify eligibility via mobile app under 'Community Discounts'); 30-day free trial for new customers

programs.name: Amazon Prime Access
programs.description: Prime membership for $6.99/month for eligible government assistance recipients or income verified customers; new customers start with a free 30-day trial

programs.name: AT&T Access
programs.description: Affordable internet with free installation

programs.name: California LifeLine Program
programs.description: Discounted or free phone and wireless service

programs.name: Good360
programs.description: Donated technology and goods including laptops, monitors, tablets, and office supplies; availability varies by donor shipments

programs.name: Goodstack Nonprofit Discounts
programs.description: Offers discounted access to essential software and tech tools like Zoom, Adobe Acrobat, Asana, and OpenAI plans for eligible nonprofit organizations

programs.name: Instacart for EBT/SNAP
programs.description: 50% off Instacart+ membership for one year; skip delivery/pickup fees with participating stores; new customers get $0 delivery on first 3 orders

programs.name: Internet Essentials by Xfinity
programs.description: Affordable home internet + Wi-Fi modem

programs.name: Kanopy for Students
programs.description: Free streaming for college students through participating campus libraries

programs.name: Tech Exchange
programs.description: Refurbished computers and technology equipment for nonprofits and community organizations; also offers digital training and tech support

programs.name: TechSoup Discount Marketplace
programs.description: Provides access to donated and deeply discounted software, hardware, cloud services, and training for nonprofits by verifying nonprofit status

programs.name: T-Mobile Project 10Million
programs.description: Free mobile hotspot device for income-eligible households with K-12 students with 200GB high-speed data per year for 5 years; optional $10/10GB data pass available when data limit is reached; free Web Guard content filtering

programs.name: Walmart+ Assist
programs.description: Eligible government assistance recipients receive Walmart+ at 50% off ($6.47/mo. or $49/yr.); new customers start with a free 30-day trial

programs.name: World Computer Exchange
programs.description: Donated computers and technology equipment for educational and nonprofit use; includes multiple Bay Area drop-off locations

programs.name: Spectrum Internet Assist
programs.description: Affordable high-speed internet for households with member participating in National School Lunch Program, Community Eligibility Provision, or receiving SSI (65+)

programs.name: Menlo Park Library Wi-Fi Hotspots
programs.description: Free 7-day checkout of portable Wi-Fi hotspots for library cardholders

programs.name: AC Transit
programs.description: Student Transit Pass Program: free unlimited rides for eligible middle and high school students

programs.name: BART
programs.description: High-Value Discount: ~6.25% off when using Autoload

programs.name: BART + Muni
programs.description: "A" Fast Pass: Unlimited Muni + BART rides within SF

programs.name: Bike Share for All (Bay Wheels)
programs.description: Discounted bike share membership for income-eligible riders

programs.name: Caltrain Dollar Fares for Youth
programs.description: $1 One-Way, $2 Day Pass for youth 18 and under

programs.name: City Coach
programs.description: Free rides for Solano College students (within Solano Co.)

programs.name: Clipper BayPass
programs.description: Unlimited rides on all 24 Bay Area transit agencies

programs.name: Clipper START
programs.description: Reduced transit fares

programs.name: DMV Reduced-Fee ID Card
programs.description: Reduced-fee state ID for eligible residents using form DL 937

programs.name: Emergency Ride Home
programs.description: Reimbursement for eligible emergency rides home (up to $125/ride, capped at $500/year)

programs.name: Emery Go-Round
programs.description: Free shuttle service throughout Emeryville

programs.name: 511 Emergency Rides
programs.description: 6 free emergency Lyft/Uber rides annually

programs.name: 511 Transit Incentives
programs.description: Free $25 Clipper card for taking transit pledge

programs.name: Lime Access
programs.description: Discounted or free Lime scooter rides (up to a set time per ride) for eligible riders

programs.name: Low Cost Auto Insurance
programs.description: State-sponsored low-cost liability insurance for income-eligible drivers

programs.name: Marin Transit
programs.description: Free rides for College of Marin students

programs.name: Muni
programs.description: Free Muni for youth (excludes cable cars), income-eligible seniors/people with disabilities, Access Pass, Lifeline Pass, free with Chase Center event ticket

programs.name: Petaluma Transit
programs.description: All local buses free to ride

programs.name: RTC Clipper Card
programs.description: Reduced fares for riders with disabilities

programs.name: SamTrans Way2Go Pass
programs.description: FREE unlimited bus pass; transit support for eligible students

programs.name: SamTrans
programs.description: Summer Youth Pass: unlimited local bus rides June‚ÄìAugust

programs.name: Santa Rosa CityBus
programs.description: Free rides for youth, children, veterans, SRJC students, some city/county workers

programs.name: Senior Clipper Card
programs.description: Discounted fares for 65+

programs.name: CID Borrow a Backup Battery
programs.description: Borrow portable batteries during Public Safety Power Shutoffs for those requiring electricity for medical reasons

programs.name: CleanPowerSF
programs.description: Additional bill-relief options for qualifying customers

programs.name: EBMUD Customer Assistance Program
programs.description: 35-50% discount on water and wastewater bills for income-eligible customers

programs.name: LIHEAP
programs.description: Up to $3,000 per year to help pay energy bills, avoid disconnection, and pay for energy efficiency improvements and energy-related home repairs

programs.name: Medical Baseline Allowance
programs.description: Extra low-cost energy allowance for customers with qualifying medical conditions requiring additional electricity or gas (including CPAP); also get alerted before Public Safety Power Shutoffs

programs.name: E-Bike Rebate
programs.description: Up to $1,000 rebate for electric bike; must participate in CARE or FERA program; can combine with other e-bike rebates

programs.name: Heat Pump Heating & Cooling Rebate
programs.description: $1,500 rebate to replace gas heater/furnace with electric heat pump; CARE customers get additional $1,000

programs.name: Home Upgrade Services
programs.description: No-cost installation services for income-eligible single-family homeowners to convert gas appliances to electric; includes assessment, pre-vetted contractor, permits, rebates, and fixed pricing

programs.name: Used Electric Vehicle Rebate
programs.description: $2,000 toward purchase of used plug-in hybrid or fully-electric vehicle from dealer; can combine with other rebates and tax credits

programs.name: Water Heater Rebate
programs.description: Up to $4,000 rebate for replacing water heater with electric heat pump ($500 for electric replacement, $2,500 for gas replacement, plus $1,000 for CARE customers and $1,000 for electrical panel upgrade)

programs.name: Zero Interest Loan for Upgrades
programs.description: Up to $10,000 zero-interest loan for electric heat pump water heaters, heating/AC, electrical panel, and energy efficiency upgrades; no money down, 5-year term

programs.name: Arrearage Management Plan (AMP)
programs.description: Save up to $8,000 on overdue utility bills for CARE customers; must owe at least $500 and be more than 90 days past due

programs.name: Automated Response Technology Program
programs.description: Get paid $25 to enroll smart devices (thermostats, batteries, EV chargers) for energy optimization; monthly lottery for $500 prize

programs.name: PG&E CARE & FERA
programs.description: 35% discount on electricity bills and 20% on natural gas through CARE; enrollment also qualifies for more incentives from other programs

programs.name: CPUC Energy Savings Assistance (ESA) Program
programs.description: Free home upgrades and repairs including heat pump water heaters, furnaces, lighting, refrigerators; all at no charge for income-eligible customers

programs.name: Generator & Battery Rebate
programs.description: $300 rebate on purchase of generator or battery storage for power outage preparedness; must be in Tier 2 or 3 High Fire-Threat District and enrolled in CARE or FERA

programs.name: Home Battery Rebate (SGIP)
programs.description: 85% discount on backup battery storage ($850 per kWh) through CPUC's Self-Generation Incentive Program Equity program

programs.name: Induction Cooktop Test Drive
programs.description: Borrow induction cooktop unit for two weeks; includes cooktop, pan, and instructions with return shipping label

programs.name: PG&E Match My Payment Program
programs.description: PG&E matches every dollar you pay up to $1,000 toward past due balance; must have at least $100 past due

programs.name: Permanent Battery Storage Rebate
programs.description: $7,500 rebate on permanent battery storage; must have experienced 5+ Enhanced Powerline Safety Settings outages since January 1, 2023; must be enrolled in Automated Demand Response and on time-of-use rate plan

programs.name: Portable Battery Program
programs.description: Free portable battery for Medical Baseline or Self-Identified Vulnerable customers who rely on medical devices and experienced PSPS or EPSS outages

programs.name: Relief for Energy Assistance through Community Help (REACH)
programs.description: Up to $300 energy credit for past-due bills if received 15-day or 48-hour disconnection notice for income-eligible customers; can apply once per 12 months

programs.name: Residential Charging Solutions Rebate
programs.description: Up to 100% rebate to cover full cost of PG&E-approved EV charging equipment installed by licensed California electrician

programs.name: Used Electric Vehicle Rebate
programs.description: $4,000 rebate for pre-owned Battery Electric or Plug-in Hybrid Electric Vehicle from dealers or private parties; can combine with other incentives

programs.name: Vehicle-to-Everything (V2X) Pilot Program
programs.description: $2,500-$4,000 rebate for two-way charger to power home from EV battery; additional $1,500 for early adopters

programs.name: WatterSaver
programs.description: $50 to enroll wifi-enabled smart electric water heater and $5/month to participate; shifts water heating to lower cost times

programs.name: Clean Cars for All - EV
programs.description: $10,000-$12,000 rebate to buy or lease new or used battery electric car when trading in pre-2008 gas/diesel vehicle; plus up to $2,000 for EV charger

programs.name: Clean Cars for All - Fuel Cell Vehicle
programs.description: $10,000 rebate to buy or lease new or used fuel cell car when trading in pre-2007 gas/diesel vehicle

programs.name: Clean Cars for All - E-Bike & Transit Credit
programs.description: $7,500 for electric bike and Bay Area transit service when trading in pre-2008 gas/diesel vehicle

programs.name: Vehicle Buy Back Program
programs.description: $2,000 to turn in working older car or small truck (2000 or older) for scrapping; must be registered in Bay Area for 2 years

programs.name: Wood Stove Replacement Program
programs.description: Up to $10,500 to replace wood-burning stove with electric heat pump ($6,500 base + $4,000 for Food Stamps/WIC/SSI recipients); or up to $1,000 for removal only; preference for disadvantaged communities

programs.name: E-Bike Rebate
programs.description: Up to $2,000 point-of-sale discount for new electric bicycle

programs.name: Old Vehicle Retirement
programs.description: $1,500-$2,000 to retire gas/diesel vehicle that failed smog check ($2,000 if failed most recent inspection)

programs.name: Driving Clean Assistance Program: Clean Cars 4 All
programs.description: Up to $10,000 + $2,000 charge card or $7,500 mobility option for trading in old gas car; includes down payment assistance, financial counseling, and lender referral

programs.name: Home EV Charger Federal Tax Credit
programs.description: 30% tax credit up to $1,000 for installing EV charger at home in eligible areas; must install before June 30, 2026

programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
programs.description: Free energy efficiency upgrades to cut bills for low-income homeowners and renters

programs.name: Efficiency and Sustainable Energy (EASE) Home Program
programs.description: BayREN covers 80% of cost for home efficiency measures (insulation, duct sealing); your share not to exceed $1,000; includes help with other rebates and fixed pricing with vetted contractors

programs.name: Home Energy Assessment
programs.description: $200 rebate for professional home energy assessment; includes score and report about potential upgrades and savings

programs.name: Water Conservation Rebates
programs.description: Rebates for irrigation systems, lawn replacement, faucets, toilets, and more; plus free conservation kit

programs.name: Whole Building Electrification
programs.description: $4,250+ for removing ALL gas appliances and installing electric alternatives (heat pump heating, heat pump water heating, electric/induction cooking, electric dryer); for single-family, multi-family low-rise, and ADUs

programs.name: Heat Pump Water Heater
programs.description: $500-$900 discount on heat pump water heater when replacing gas or electric tank; can combine with other incentives

programs.name: High Efficiency Gas Water Heater
programs.description: $75 discount on high efficiency gas water heater when replacing similar sized gas unit; can combine with federal incentives

programs.name: Room Air Conditioner
programs.description: $90 discount on Energy Star-certified room air conditioner

programs.name: Smart Thermostat
programs.description: $40-$60 rebate on programmable smart thermostat; home must have AC and gas furnace; must replace non-smart thermostat

programs.name: OhmConnect
programs.description: $50 credit plus bill savings; rewards for reducing energy during peak periods; can get free/discounted smart thermostat and smart plug

programs.name: QuitCarbon Rebate
programs.description: Up to $300 rebate for heat pump HVAC, heat pump water heater, electrical upgrades, solar/battery, or battery-equipped induction range ($100 first upgrade, $200 second); projects over $4,000

programs.name: Recology 25% Low-Income Discount Program
programs.description: 25% discount on garbage collection bills for qualifying customers

programs.name: Building Electrification Rebate Program
programs.description: $500 rebate for city residents to install heat pump hot water heater, $500 for high-efficiency heat pump, up to $500 for electrical panel upgrade; CARE customers get additional $500

programs.name: Electric Vehicle (EV) Charger Rebate Program
programs.description: $500 rebate for city residents to install Level 2 EV charger at home

programs.name: Electric Lawn Care Equipment Rebate
programs.description: Up to $150 for city residents, $300 for city-based businesses when turning in gas-powered equipment for electric versions (leaf blower, string trimmer, hedge trimmer, edger, cultivator/tiller)

programs.name: Solar Rebate Program
programs.description: $500 rebate for city residents to install solar; can combine with federal tax credits

programs.name: Green House Call
programs.description: Free online energy assessment plus free lightbulbs, shower heads, and other energy/water saving measures

programs.name: SFPUC Customer Assistance Program (CAP)
programs.description: Increased 40% discount on water and sewer bills; protections from shutoffs/late fees for CAP participants

programs.name: Mercury Thermostat Recycling Rebate
programs.description: $30 mail-in rebate per mercury thermostat when recycled at designated drop-off location

programs.name: Electric Bicycle Rebate
programs.description: 10% rebate on new e-bike purchase, up to $300; income-qualified customers can receive additional $200

programs.name: EV Charging Station Rebate
programs.description: Up to $550 rebate for installing electric vehicle charging station; available for home, multifamily, schools, non-profit, and commercial facilities

programs.name: Income-Qualified Pre-Owned Electric Vehicle Rebate
programs.description: Up to $3,500 for pre-owned EV ($1,500 for fully electric, $1,000 for plug-in hybrid); LIHEAP-eligible customers may get $1,000 bonus; vehicles with MPGe 117+ may get additional $1,000 bonus

programs.name: Induction Cooktop, Range & Oven Rebate
programs.description: Up to $750 rebate for replacing gas with induction range; income-qualified customers may receive up to $950; cooktop and wall oven replacements also available

programs.name: Heat Pump Clothes Dryer Rebate
programs.description: Up to $250 rebate for replacing gas dryer with high-efficiency heat pump dryer; income-qualified customers may receive up to $350

programs.name: Electric Clothes Dryer Rebate
programs.description: Up to $150 rebate for replacing gas dryer with electric dryer; income-qualified customers may receive up to $350

programs.name: Heat Pump Water Heater Rebate (Gas Replacement)
programs.description: Up to $5,500 rebate for replacing gas water heater with ENERGY STAR heat pump water heater; income-qualified customers may receive up to $6,500

programs.name: Heat Pump Water Heater Rebate (Electric Replacement)
programs.description: $500 rebate for replacing electric resistance water heater with ENERGY STAR heat pump water heater; income-qualified customers may receive additional $500

programs.name: Heat Pump HVAC Rebate
programs.description: Up to $10,000 rebate ($3,000 per ton) for replacing gas furnace and/or AC with high-efficiency electric heat pump HVAC; income-qualified customers may receive up to $11,000

programs.name: HVAC Tune-Up Rebate
programs.description: Up to $75 rebate for HVAC tune-up by CA licensed contractor

programs.name: Circuit Pauser or Splitter Rebate
programs.description: Up to $50 rebate for circuit pauser/splitter to enable electrification without panel upgrade; income-qualified customers may receive up to $150

programs.name: Smart Electric Panel Rebate
programs.description: $4,000 rebate for upgrading to smart electric panel (KOBEN, Lumin, SPAN) to avoid main service upgrade; income-qualified customers may receive additional $1,000-$2,000

programs.name: Main Service Panel Upgrade Rebate
programs.description: Up to $1,500 rebate for upgrading main panel to higher amperage for EV charger or electric appliance installation; income-qualified customers may receive up to $2,500

programs.name: New Circuits for Future Electric Appliances Rebate
programs.description: Up to $500 per circuit (max $2,000 for 4 circuits) for prewiring future electric appliances; income-qualified customers may receive up to $1,000 per circuit (max $4,000)

programs.name: Battery Storage Rebate
programs.description: $0.15 per Wh up to $2,700 for battery storage with solar PV; FRAP customers get additional $2,000; LIHEAP-eligible customers get additional $2,000

programs.name: Energy Efficiency Grant for HOAs
programs.description: Up to $25,000 grant for HOAs with 25+ units on D-1 rate to fund energy efficiency upgrades to common areas; 20% matching funds required

programs.name: Income-Qualified Solar Grant
programs.description: Free solar PV system grant of $3.50 per watt up to 3 kW for homeowners on FRAP program for 1+ year

programs.name: Variable Speed Pool Pump Rebate
programs.description: $100 rebate for ENERGY STAR variable speed pool filtration pump with qualifying controller

programs.name: Solar Tune-Up Rebate
programs.description: Up to $1,500 rebate for solar PV system tune-up by CA licensed contractor

programs.name: SJ Cares Discount
programs.description: 10% discount on SJCE electricity charges; automatic enrollment for CARE or FERA customers

programs.name: Solar Access Program
programs.description: 20% off electricity bill; stacks with CARE/FERA for up to 55% total savings

programs.name: EcoHome Heat Pump Water Heater Rebate
programs.description: $2,000 rebate for replacing gas water heater with heat pump water heater; Environmental Justice Community or income-qualified residents receive $3,000

programs.name: EcoHome Heat Pump HVAC Rebate
programs.description: $1,500 rebate for replacing gas furnace with heat pump HVAC; Environmental Justice Community or income-qualified residents receive $2,500

programs.name: EcoHome Battery Storage Rebate
programs.description: $125 per kWh up to $3,250 for battery storage with solar PV; Environmental Justice Community or income-qualified residents receive $400 per kWh up to $10,400

programs.name: EcoHome Panel Upgrade Rebate
programs.description: $1,000 rebate for electrical panel upgrade as add-on to other EcoHome rebate

programs.name: EcoHome Attic Insulation Rebate
programs.description: $500 rebate for attic insulation as add-on to other EcoHome rebate

programs.name: EcoHome Circuit Prewiring Rebate
programs.description: $500 rebate for circuit prewiring as add-on to other EcoHome rebate

programs.name: New EV Instant Rebate
programs.description: $4,000 instant rebate on new battery electric vehicle (max vehicle price $60,000); must be within 100% Area Median Income or enrolled in CARE/FERA

programs.name: Used EV Instant Rebate
programs.description: $2,000 instant rebate on used battery electric vehicle (max vehicle price $60,000); must be within 100% Area Median Income or enrolled in CARE/FERA

programs.name: Peak Rewards Program
programs.description: Earn $0.50-$1.00 per kWh reduced during peak hours; $20 enrollment bonus; up to 6 earning opportunities monthly with no penalty for non-participation

programs.name: Peak Rewards for Smart Thermostats
programs.description: $35 per year for enrolling Google Nest or Sensi smart thermostat in demand response program; thermostat auto-adjusts during peak events with option to override

programs.name: Peak Rewards for EV Chargers
programs.description: $25 enrollment bonus plus $9 per month for enrolling Emporia EV charger in managed charging program; charging pauses during peak events with option to override

programs.name: Peak Rewards for Battery Storage
programs.description: $10 per kWh enrollment bonus plus $0.13 per kWh quarterly for enrolling battery storage in demand response program

programs.name: Rate Assistance Program (RAP)
programs.description: Up to 25% off gas and/or electricity charges on monthly utility bills for those with financial hardship or medical conditions requiring higher utility use

programs.name: Residential Energy Assistance Program (REAP)
programs.description: Free home energy and water efficiency installations including weather stripping, attic insulation, heating systems, water heaters, showerheads, and lighting

programs.name: ProjectPLEDGE
programs.description: One-time utility bill assistance for past-due amounts up to $750

programs.name: Heat Pump Water Heater Rebate
programs.description: $3,500 rebate for replacing gas water heater with heat pump water heater; full-service installation as low as $2,300 or $1,100 with $20/month payments for 5 years

programs.name: Heat Pump HVAC Rebate
programs.description: $2,500 rebate for replacing gas furnace with heat pump HVAC system

programs.name: Gas Meter Removal Incentive
programs.description: $2,500 incentive for fully electrifying your home with confirmation of gas meter removal

programs.name: EV Charger Rebate for Multi-Family and Non-Profits
programs.description: Up to $80,000 for installing EV chargers at schools, non-profits, multi-family, and mixed-use properties

programs.name: Transformer Upgrade Rebate Program
programs.description: Up to $10,000 for single-family homes or $100,000 for schools/non-profits/multi-family for infrastructure upgrades related to EV charger installation

programs.name: Landscape Conversion Rebate
programs.description: Up to $4 per sq ft for converting lawn and/or swimming pool to sustainable, low-water-use landscape; artificial turf not eligible

programs.name: Graywater Laundry-to-Landscape Rebate
programs.description: Up to $400 for installing graywater laundry-to-landscape system to direct washer rinse water to landscape

programs.name: Stormwater Rebates Program
programs.description: Rebates for rain barrels, cisterns, pervious pavement, and rain gardens to reduce stormwater runoff
